page.title: 01NEWCASTLE AIRPORT
page.content:
50 YEARS OF PROGRESS ++++++++++++++++++++
{Newcastle Airport}is the major international airport in the{North {East,}it plays a vital role in the communication and economic growth of the region.
{Newcastle Airport}was opened on July 1935 by Sir Philip Cunliffe-Lister, the secretary of state for air. Now Newcastle Airport is celebrating its 50th birthday. It also was a dream come true for Newcastle's former{Lord {Mayor}Sir Stephen Easton, chairman of the Municipal Aerodromes Special Committee because it took him 6 years to persuade his colleagues in the city council that spending a total of 35 million on a{City Airport}would not be a waste of money.
